gui
Class GameToolBar

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JToolBar
                  help.NewJToolBar
                      gui.GameToolBar
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
GraphToolBar, TriToolBar
public abstract class GameToolBar
extends NewJToolBar

This class describes the ToolBar for setting options or drawing graphs for creating the game board. Then it provides several options, like starting the game or the input mode. There is also can be chosen whether the game shall be recorded.

Author:
Irene Thesing
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

gameboard

protected GameBoard gameboard
The corresponding game board.

recChecker

protected final javax.swing.JCheckBox recChecker
The checkbox where the record function can be chosen.

owner

protected MainFrame owner
The main frame, where the game board and this toolbar are shown. It is necessary to address the center panel of it to put new components there.

analyse

protected AnalyseToolBar analyse
The toolbar to analyse the game, shown below the game when started.

Constructor Detail

GameToolBar

public GameToolBar(GameBoard board)
Creates a new ToolBar for the game. It is necessary to call #setOwner() after creating a new toolbar.

Parameters:
board - the game board, which can be addressed by the options on the toolbar.
Method Detail

getSubclassConstant

protected abstract int getSubclassConstant()
Returns the constant for the subclass to see different help frames.

Returns:
subclass constant from the help frame.

changeToOtherGame

protected abstract void changeToOtherGame()
Changes the whole board to the other game.

initOptionPart

protected abstract void initOptionPart()
Initializes the property part of the toolbar, which depends on the concret game, so it must be implemented in the subclass.

additionalStartAction

protected abstract AnalyseToolBar additionalStartAction()
Sometimes it is necessary to do some changes on the game board if the game is started. Therefore this method is called while clicking on the start button first.

Returns:
the ToolBar to do analyses of the game which shall be shown.

additionalInputAction

protected abstract void additionalInputAction()
Sometimes it is necessary to do some changes on the game board if the input mode is started. Therefore this method is called while clicking on the input button first.

setOwner

public void setOwner(MainFrame mainFrame)
This method must be called after creating a new GameToolBar to make the connection to the gameboard, such that there can be made changes.

Parameters:
mainFrame - the main frame where everything takes place.
